intro: Struthiola angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf struthiola, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Struthiola angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
